title: In your opinion, what’s wrong with the Christian music industry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sorry if this offends but it's the first thing that came to mind: Christ Fest Then there's this:  Don't get me wrong, it's catchy and danceable and you can ride the wave of energy (like a rave) to work up ‘worship.’ Praise pit? The lyrics in a lot of CCM songs are frequently some combination of Father, Son, Spirit, Lord, Jesus and some mix of Biblical or churchified insider words tossed into one big lyrical salad or directed to a generic ‘You' leaving the listener to fill in the blanks as to the ‘who' and while it feels good it is muddy at best if much thought is given to it. Often the theology is just plain bad. Don't get me wrong. There are some gems that come along but it is an industry with awards shows and big dollars. There is a sound, a look and a vibe that makes it stereotypable (is that a word?). CCM is not alone in this regard. So much of it is imitative and feels copycat to what the world offers with the culture leading the way. Like this:  Or my favorite, Holy Ghost Tees (yes, really):
